pr_title: ELMAH: by default dont report files without expected content

timeline.bodyText: I'd remove all HTML content, it could be an empty string and just the evidence string (in the handlers), no other parts of the content are being analysed/used by the scan rule (e.g. swapping FORBIDDEN_RESPONSE with VALID_RESPONSE_WITHOUT_CONTENT yields the same result).
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: Merge this with the following and call it shouldNotAlertIfNon200CodeStdThreshold? (and test with e.g. 401, 403, 404, 500?) Move closer to shouldAlertIfForbiddenResponseLowThreshold?
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: shouldAlertIfBehindAuthLowThreshold and test with 401 as well?
timeline.author: thc202
thc202

timeline.bodyText: StatusCodeResponse? And allow to pass the status code (to test with other status codes, 401, 404..).
timeline.author: thc202
thc202
thc202

timeline.message:
ELMAH: by default dont report files without expected content

Signed-off-by: Simon Bennetts <psiinon@gmail.com>
